intro: Scorzonera turkica, commonly known as Turkish scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia, including Turkey. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy, upright stems and yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces small, oval-shaped tubers that are used in traditional medicine and cuisine. Scorzonera turkica thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
